Package br.com.kirgh.app.exceptions

Class HandleErrors

java.lang.Object
br.com.kirgh.app.exceptions.HandleErrors
@RestControllerAdvice public class HandleErrors extends Object
This class contains exception handlers for various types of exceptions and returns a map of error details for each exception.

  • Method Details

    • handleValidationException

      @ResponseStatus(BAD_REQUEST) @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.web.bind.MethodArgumentNotValidException.class) public Map<String,String> handleValidationException(org.springframework.web.bind.MethodArgumentNotValidException ex)
      This function handles validation exceptions by creating a map of field names and error messages.
      Parameters:
      ex - "ex" is an instance of the "MethodArgumentNotValidException" class, which is thrown when the validation of a method argument fails. This exception contains information about the validation errors that occurred.
      Returns:
      A map of field names and their corresponding error messages, along with a timestamp. This is the result of handling a MethodArgumentNotValidException, which occurs when a request parameter fails validation. The map is created by iterating through all errors in the exception's BindingResult and extracting the field name and error message for each FieldError.

    • handleConflict

      @ResponseStatus(CONFLICT) @ExceptionHandler(java.lang.IllegalArgumentException.class) public Map<String,String> handleConflict(IllegalArgumentException ex)
      This function handles the IllegalArgumentException and returns a map of error messages.
      Parameters:
      ex - "ex" is the variable name for the IllegalArgumentException object that is being caught by this exception handler method. It is used to access the properties and methods of the exception object, such as the error message.
      Returns:
      A Map<String, String> containing the timestamp and error message is being returned. This is the result of handling a IllegalArgumentException with a @ResponseStatus annotation that sets the HTTP status code to CONFLICT. The method also prints the stack trace of the exception.

    • handleConflict

      @ResponseStatus(BAD_REQUEST) @ExceptionHandler(org.springframework.web.HttpMediaTypeNotSupportedException.class) public Map<String,String> handleConflict(org.springframework.web.HttpMediaTypeNotSupportedException ex)
      This function handles the HttpMediaTypeNotSupportedException and returns a map of error messages.
      Parameters:
      ex - "ex" is the variable name for the HttpMediaTypeNotSupportedException object that is being caught by this exception handler method. It is used to access the properties and methods of the exception object, such as the error message.
      Returns:
      A Map<String, String> containing the timestamp and error message is being returned. This is the result of handling a HttpMediaTypeNotSupportedException with a @ResponseStatus annotation that sets the HTTP status code to BAD_REQUEST. The method also prints the stack trace of the exception.

    • handleNotFound

      @ResponseStatus(NOT_FOUND) @ExceptionHandler(jakarta.persistence.EntityNotFoundException.class) public Map<String,String> handleNotFound(jakarta.persistence.EntityNotFoundException ex)
      This Java function handles the exception thrown when an entity is not found and returns a map of error details.
      Parameters:
      ex - ex is an instance of the EntityNotFoundException class, which is an exception thrown when an entity (such as a database record) is not found. The @ExceptionHandler annotation is used to handle this exception and return a custom error response with a HttpStatus.NOT_FOUND status code
      Returns:
      A Map containing the timestamp and error message for the EntityNotFoundException that was caught.

    • handle

      @ResponseStatus(INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR) @ExceptionHandler(java.lang.Exception.class) public Map<String,String> handle(Exception ex)
      This is an exception handler that returns a map of error details for internal server errors.
      Parameters:
      ex - "ex" is a variable representing the exception that was thrown. It is used in the method to catch any type of exception that may occur during the execution of the code.
      Returns:
      A Map object containing the timestamp and an error message is being returned. This is the result of handling an exception of type Exception with the @ExceptionHandler annotation and the @ResponseStatus annotation indicating that the HTTP status code should be set to INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR. The method logs the exception stack trace and returns a map with the timestamp and error message.
